message.content:
<<<api>>>: DataOutputStream.write
<<<code>>>: DataOutputStream dos = new DataOutputStream(new FileOutputStream("archive.bin"));
int numberOfFiles = 10; // example
dos.writeInt(numberOfFiles);
<<<explanation>>>: The `writeInt` method of `DataOutputStream` writes an `int` to the underlying output stream as four bytes, high byte first (also known as big-endian). This will automatically expand your integer into 4 bytes. If the integer is less than 4 bytes, it will be padded with leading zeros. If it is more than 4 bytes, it will be truncated.
